Elders,

Then the World-Honored One further extensively expounded the Dharma of bodily practices and praised in verse:
It is very difficult to attain a human body, do not create evil actions with the body,
Eventually you will die and be abandoned in a charnel ground, eaten by foxes and wolves, or rot away.
Deceiving oneself, always deluded, solely giving rise to thoughts of greed and desire for form,
This body seeks nothing in return, suffering various pains day and night.
Because of various sufferings, troubles are formed. The body is full of festering impurities,
Constantly exhausted by hunger and thirst. How could a wise person crave life?
Constantly receiving a body, never being content, forcefully raising and nurturing, more intimate than close relatives,
Because of seeing form, one commits various offenses, and because of this, one receives the pain of hell.
The body cannot be like vajra, do not use it to create evil karma.
Although one may live for a long time, one will eventually return to death. At that time, give rise to faith and mindfulness of the Buddha's world.
Even if one raises the body for a long time, with delicious food and fragrant flowers,
Hunger and thirst will not always be present. Even if one strives, what benefit is there?
Again, after many eons, one will encounter the world of the honored Buddha, the hero among men.
Always give rise to faith and do not commit offenses, lest one fall into the three and receive bitter suffering.
Their lifespan is millions of years, diligently striving like putting out a fire,
How much more so for those who live a hundred years, indulging in creating prison-like misfortune.
If there are thoughts of self, obtaining a human body is extremely difficult,
Always indulging in the five desires, enjoying oneself, how can one know the future?
This pleasure is not permanent, all suffering and poison will soon arrive,
One should quickly part with stinginess and greed, and attain great blessings.
Wealth is like a dream, using this false to deceive sentient beings,
Sometimes existing for a while, then disappearing, the wise do not begrudge wealth.
If it is like an illusory form deceiving, displaying false and colorful flowers,
Who deceives the body with this wealth of desire? The foolish and turbid fall into delusion.
Using suffering to attain wealth and blessings, because of the body, thinking of giving and conceptualizing,
Wealth and non-wealth, the affairs of the five families, what wisdom is there to be deluded by wealth?
Mistakenly following wife and children, having wealth forcibly taken away by the power of the king,
Aware of impermanence and understanding this, there is never any intention to enjoy wealth.
Affection and love lead to suffering and distress, do not greedily become attached to the prison of the family,
Parents, wealth, body, wife and children, all remain behind while one goes on their own.
Those who are greedy and stingy are not self-aware, only fearing that wealth will perish with them,
The foolish and stubborn strive for wealth with force, the wise contemplate and believe in non-greed.
The stingy and unbelieving cannot be relied upon, extremely humble like a child or servant,
Externally burnt by greed, internally heated by flattery, not praised by the sages and worthies.
Discussing books or composing poems, using them to confuse the crowd like a prostitute,
The mind coarse and violent, the nature violent and harsh, the stingy people are mostly jealous and envious.
The nature of greed and lust has no friends, yet it appears humble and forcefully befriends people.
Only for the sake of wealth does it pursue suffering. The wise should not trust it.
Because of wealth, one gives rise to this matter, and then creates a poisonous and harmful mind.
Therefore, the wise should examine and abandon stinginess, jealousy, and evil deeds.

Because of this, disputes arise. One should control this intention and rectify it with the Dharma.

Greedily looking at forms and desires confuses oneself. Lust arises and one loses one's will.
Following desires and inversions, when will we encounter a Buddha's world?
For ninety-one eons, the world has had the honored enlightened Buddha,
Mount Sumeru burned and destroyed, what conditions will we encounter later?
The seas, ponds, and pools dried up, the heavens and earth scorched with nothing remaining,
Desires blazing are also like this, what wisdom is there to become attached to desires?
All the wise and intelligent ones should observe and know to dwell in tranquility,
What is there to crave or enjoy?
Understanding this meaning, one does not enter the net.

Attached to affection and greedy thoughts, one cannot escape the suffering and misfortune of prison.

Then alone one goes following the suffering and pain, there is no one to replace one's suffering.
The troubles of the three realms are nothing worse than wife and children,
Originally loving them is seeking happiness, but in turn they become the root of sorrow and suffering.
Because of them, one experiences the suffering of the three evil paths, and the pain of poison, bitterness, and acridity arises.

The Dharma King will expound and analyze, discerning the pure practice.
The body creates karma and will experience it oneself, letting the mind follow and fall into distress.

When one experiences suffering, parents and relatives cannot save them.
Even with deep kindness, there is no substitute, so the wise have no attachment to desires.
If one wishes to escape the prison of suffering and the various bonds of shackles and chains,
One should diligently contemplate and abandon desires, and quickly practice the Dharma taught by the Hero of the World.
The household is greatly burning with the roots of affliction, like a fire constantly blazing.
What wise one would delight in this?

The foolish children have no such aspiration, but are deluded and fall into hell.
Between heaven and earth, those who are exclusively deluded, give rise to thoughts of my wife and children,
The foolish and stubborn think they will always exist, not knowing that the body is an illusory transformation.
